description: In the sequence of positive integers add 1 to each prime number.
comments: For n >= 3, a(n) = smallest composite number m such that m - (n-2) is a prime. - _Amarnath Murthy_ and Antonio G. Astudillo (afg_astudillo(AT)hotmail.com), Mar 08 2003.
links: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = n + pi(n) - pi(n-1). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jun 15 2013a(n) = n + A010051(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 01 2014
prog: (PARI) a(n)=n+isprime(n)(Haskell)a014683 n = n + a010051' n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 01 2014
author: _Mohammad K. Azarian_
